page.title: 19Changing Times
page.content: Cockernhoe Village is only two hundred metres away from the Luton border,and for the last two years has been an unwilling onlooker of a rapidly- developing housing programme for the Wigmore Estate in Luton.Villagers have expressed views that the new houses are too crowded and too 'box-like' in shape.They miss their now lost views over fields. More importantly,they have suffered the closure of the only road linking Cockernhoe with Luton for six weeks while sewage pipes were laid, and are now facing,in early 1986, a closure which may last for a minimum of six months.As a result of village concern, the Parish Council have been asked to approach the Member of Parliament for help in discussing alternative plans.Meanwhile,villagers must make a detour through Tea Green.As they point
